e4: Shifting to the new policy promotes transparency by eliminating biased earnings reporting, which provides a truer measure of the firm’s performance. e5: An ethical reporting policy should emphasize transparency, accuracy, and fairness, ensuring all investors receive truthful and unbiased financial information. It should comply with legal standards, safeguard investor interests, and foster trust by avoiding manipulative or misleading practices. Consideration for the impact on less-informed investors is also necessary.
